weka.core
Class RSession

java.lang.Object
  weka.core.RSession

public class RSession
extends java.lang.Object

Maintains a proxy singleton interface to the actual RSession implementation. We use this rather convoluted process because of the limitation that native libraries may be loaded only once (by one class loader) combined with the fact that the R runtime is single threaded. This means that the JRI Rengine interface is also a singleton and all clients must use it. Because of this, there would be problems in a multi class loader situation (like an app server) if more than one classloader/plugin loads the JRI interface. For this reason we have to ensure that the root class loader not only loads the native library (so that it is visible to all child class loaders) but also loads some key classes from this package plus all the JRI-related classes. Reflection-based byte code injection is used to make this happen (see the JRILoader class).

Many thanks to the snappy-java guys for their clear and well documented code demonstrating this approach (hacky though it may be). http://code.google.com/p/snappy-java/.

Version:
$Revision: 50377 $
Author:
Mark Hall (mhall{[at]}pentaho{[dot]}com)

Returns:
the session singleton
Throws:
java.lang.Exception - if the session is currently held by another client

releaseSession

public static void releaseSession(java.lang.Object requester)
Release the session so that other clients can obtain it. This method does nothing if the requester is not the current session holder

Parameters:
requester - the session holder

createReference

public org.rosuda.REngine.REXP createReference(java.lang.Object requester,
                                               org.rosuda.REngine.REXP source)
                                        throws RSessionException,
                                               org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException,
                                               org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
Pushes an REXP back into R and, if successful, returns a reference REXP that points to the pushed object in R. The reference can be used in an assign() to assign a variable to the object.

Parameters:
requester - the requesting object
source - the source object to push into R
Returns:
a reference to the object in R
Throws:
RSessionException - if the requester is not the current session holder
org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException - if a problem occurs on the R end
org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException - if a problem occurs on the R end

get

public org.rosuda.REngine.REXP get(java.lang.Object requester,
                                   java.lang.String var)
                            throws RSessionException,
                                   org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException,
                                   org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException
Get a named object from R. If the object is a reference (pointer) then this will return a fully dereferenced REXP.

Parameters:
requester - the requesting object
var - the name of the variable in R to get
Returns:
the fully dereferenced R object corresponding to var
Throws:
RSessionException - if the requester is not the current session holder
org.rosuda.REngine.REngineException - if a problem occurs on the R end
org.rosuda.REngine.REXPMismatchException - if a problem occurs on the R end
